Pre-Game Insights: Brenton Doyle and Jake Burger are the hottest hitters on both teams.
The Rockies have been favorites in three games this season and won two (66.7%) of those contests.
Colorado has played as favorites of -138 or more twice this season and split those games.
The bookmakers' moneyline implies a 58% chance of a victory for the Rockies.
The Marlins have won in 44, or 37.6%, of the 117 contests they have been named as odds-on underdogs this year.
Miami has come away with a win 33 times in 88 chances when named as an underdog of at least +117 or worse on the moneyline.
The Rockies have a 2-1 record over the three games they were a moneyline favorite in their last 10 matchups.
Over their last 10 outings, the Rockies and their opponents combined to go over the total four times (all 10 games had set totals).
The Rockies' record against the spread is 5-5-0 over their past 10 games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Doyle leads the Rockies in home runs (21) and runs batted in (63).
Burger leads the Marlins in home runs (25), runs batted in (59) and has a team-best batting average of.248.
